***** Translingual[edit] *****
[//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/0/00/Deva-%E0%A4%99-order.gif]
**** Letter[edit] ****
ङ (ṅ)
   1. The Devanagari script's voiced velar nasal consonant; ṅ: /ŋ/
**** See also[edit] ****

***** Gamale Kham[edit] *****
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * IPA(key): /ŋə/
**** Letter[edit] ****
ङ (ṇa)
   1. Used to represent the [ŋ] sound in Gamale Kham
*** See also[edit] ***
    * (Devanagari script letters) अ,‎ आ,‎ इ,‎ ई,‎ उ,‎ ऊ,‎ ऋ,‎ ऌ,‎ ए,‎ ऐ,‎ ओ,‎

**** Letter[edit] ****
ङ • (ṅa)
   1. the fifth consonant in Hindi

***** Nepali[edit] *****
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * IPA(key): [ŋʌ]
    * Phonetic Devanagari: ङ
**** Letter[edit] ****
ङ • (ṅa)
   1. The fifth consonant in Nepali.
***** Newar[edit] *****
**** Alternative forms[edit] ****
    * (Kathmandu) ञ (ña)
**** Etymology[edit] ****
From Proto-Sino-Tibetan *s-ŋja.
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * IPA(key): [ŋə]
**** Noun[edit] ****
ङ • (ṅa) ? (Newa Spelling 𑐒)
   1. (Dolakhae) fish

**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * (Vedic) IPA(key): /ŋɐ/

**** Noun[edit] ****
ङ • (ṅa)
   1. An object of sense
   2. Desire, wish.
   3. An epithet of Śiva
